name: Woodstocker Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ideal hospitality, warm yet allowed us to enjoy the comfortable surroundings without feeling watched. The brave colors complement the historical aspects of the inn. We enjoyed a clean room, comfortable surroundings, amazing library, yummy food, and respite from our beloved children.
reviews.title: Exactly what we needed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our thanks to the Tourist Board for recommending this little gem.
reviews.title: This is the perfect place to stay if you value peace, good quality food and special attention to detail.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As you enter Woodstock the bright yellow exterior of the Woodstocker Inn doesn't fail to get it noticed (reminded me of a honey pot). Step inside and you are met with a calm atmosphere of order and cleanliness that is second to none. And the breakfast that awaits you in the morning is to die for! Organic, local and cooked to order. For us it was the most relaxing and enjoyable of experiences. Loved the walks, loved the town and have nothing but praise and admiration for our fellow Brits, Dora and David, for all they have achieved. I wish them well and would recommend you all to pay them a visit, I certainly would not hesitate to stay with them again.
reviews.title: A perfect stay

reviews.text: This was our first stay at the Woodstocker though we have been to the area many times previously. The Woodstocker is where we'll stay on future visits. The location is ideal, the innkeepers clearly love what they do and make the satisfaction of guests their highest priority. They were even happy to give me the gear I needed to wash my car. Each room is done differently, and all are original and tasteful with no B&B/Inn cliches. The breakfast was terrific, a wide array of cold items with a cooked-to-order entree, everything using local products, many organic and all delicious. There are comfortable sitting areas, and refreshments available 24/7. This is a first-rate inn in every way.
reviews.title: A Pleasure Every Time We Visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our third stay at the Inn and it always meets our expectations. It's fun to come back year after year and see what rooms have been remodeled since we were last there. It's a comfortable, welcoming environment and we very much enjoyed it! David and Dora are most gracious hosts!
reviews.title: A refreshing combination of modern indulgences with Vermont charm.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arriving in Woodstock, this place was recommended by all the locals as an experience not to be missed, due to its especially friendly owners and wonderful location. It did not disappoint in any aspect, from its wonderful decor, individually styled rooms, food and helpfulness of Dave & Dora (not forgetting Daisy Doo). An unforgettable experience in an unforgettable town.
reviews.title: A perfect home from home!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent a couple nights at the Woodstocker Inn over Labor Day weekend. We loved everything about it. After a busy week that took us to different places, we met at the Inn in separate cars. I arrived first - several hours before our room was ready. This wasn't a problem at all - I was directed to a cozy library near the front of the Inn, a cozy room with comfortable chairs, right next to a little kitchen with real coffee and snacks. We stayed in the Chelsea room - the one with the red tub and sink. It's bright, and cheerful, and just plain fun. David and Dora have style and character, traits that permeate everything about the Inn. They have done a lot of interesting things, love to share stories, but also know when to give guests space. The location is also excellent - very close to the center of Woodstock. We will definitely be back!
reviews.title: The Woodstocker is a unique and wonderful B&B with a personality!

reviews.text: When we realized we would be late checking into the Woodstocker, we called the inn's owners. They were very hospitable and made arrangements for us to enter and access our room. Our room was lovely and spacious with two double beds, comfortable seating, and private bathroom. An English breakfast was served each morning. We really appreciated the use of local produce, meats etc. I wouldn't hesitate recommending the Woodstocker Inn to others who may be planning a trip to Vermont and personally hope to be able to visit again soon.
reviews.title: Our stay at the Woodstocker Inn was a warm and welcoming one.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were greeted and helped with our luggage and told all information we needed including a small kitchen with snacks and drinks if we wanted a midnight snack. Our room was very clean and immenities great! Loved the shampoo and body lotion. WIFI available and included if needed which is a very nice feature. The Inn is close enough to town that we walked every morning and evening. Our breakfasts were organic and excellent, a great way to begin our day!
reviews.title: A Gem Nestled In Woodstock, Vermont

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Truly a great find in this area. Quiet, clean rooms. Delicious home cooked breakfast. We appreciated the "green" philosophy of this more contemporary B&B. Didn't smell of roses or old lace...that's for sure. Be sure to check out their extensive library (from David's prior job in book sales), cozy up with a tea and lemon cake from the pantry or a handful of chocolates from the candy bowls dotting the place. Really, really a great address!
reviews.title: A warm welcome...spotlessly clean, yummy food and lots of chocolate!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently spent a couple nights at the Woodstocker Inn. One of the things that made our experience so wonderful is David and Dora. The hosts are fabulous, very welcoming, easy to chat with and full of suggestion about local dining and activity. Our room, the Westminster was wonderful. The bed was so comfortable and the bathroom was outstanding. The 2 bath tubs, the skylight and the little blue lights made our experience very relaxing. The modern look of the room was exactly what we were looking for.
reviews.title: Warm-Friendly-Modern ... Green B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We truly appreciated the no “outdoor shoes” and no kids policy. Having kids of our owns spending time away from kids was great.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location couldn't be better--within easy walking distance of the village.
reviews.title: This is a unique B&B with a fun atmosphere, great breakfast and very friendly owners.

reviews.text: Breakfast…mmm were delicious… Loved Dora’s granola and fruit compote. Love all of it… the sausage was also very good..
reviews.title: Very comfortable stay in a very welcoming environment-great breakfast!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, we had a great stay and are already planning our return visit to the Woodstocker.
reviews.title: We loved it!
A gem in Woodstock
reviews.text: We stayed at the Woodstocker for one night and wish we could have stayed longer. The rooms are immaculate and cleverly designed. My husband and I were amazed that the owners could keep the charm and coziness of an old country house without the mustiness or datedness that many old homes have. The breakfast was delicious, and you could tell the owners cared about their guests' experiences. We will definitely stay here for all future trips to Woodstock.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: By far this was the nicest B&B we stayed at on this trip. Both Dora & David were helpful in making us feel at home. Dora gave us directions on a scenic route to take when we went to dinner.
reviews.title: Although we were only there one night, Dora and David made us feel like family.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We'd never previously stayed at B&B, always preferring a bigger hotel, but staying at the Woodstocker will make think twice in future. Spotlessly clean, lovely house with modern and individually designed rooms. Hosts were friendly, welcoming and happy to answer queries without ever being too over bearing. We spent a lovely hour in the library without being disturbed by other guests or host. Nice walk into town which was lovely, a few restaurants but quite expensive. Overall, it was a fantastic experience.
reviews.title: Fantastic B&B experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were colorful, clean, comfortable and restful! The Innkeepers were a delight and the food was excellent! Chocolate samples were everywhere for the chocolate lovers, breakfast was great and the coffee/ tea was perfection. Charming, restful and a great location to the down town. A wonderful experience, we hope to revisit at some point in time.
reviews.title: Wonderful experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved this inn. The inn keepers were very friendly, knowledgeable about the area, and made delicious eggs. The room was clean and comfortable, with all the necessary amenities.
reviews.title: Fantastic and comfortable B&B

description: The original village 'green' Inn - AWARDS 2012 Telegraph UK - Worlds Best British owned inn. 2010/11 Innkeepers of the Year 2008/9 Top 12 in World 2007/8 Top 10 in USA all at Bed & Breakfast com + 9 other awards, more than all the other Woodstock B & B/inns combined! Vermont Governors 'green hotel'. D3 - European owners provide adult indulgence, eclectic mix of relaxation, cakes & chocolate using organic sources. We operate a 'warts & all' policy. Motto ‘only as good as our guests say we are!’
